overview_of_class:
This introductory course is designed for undergraduate science and engineering students who are interested in quantitatively exploring the observed universe in terms of the underlying physical processes. The astrophysical topics on the menu include the detection and architecture of exoplanets, the formation and evolution of stars, the active nuclei of galaxies, clusters of galaxies, and the accelerating expansion of the universe.
Team projects based on either data analysis of astronomy archives or engineering designs will be considered to take the place of home work assignments.
name: Introduction to Astrophysics
title: WCAS ASTRON 220-0-1 Introduction to Astrophysics
